DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine treat periodontal infection ( gum disease ) reduce marker systemic inflammation patient risk cardiovascular disease .
DOC.detailed_description: Aims : To determine effect periodontal treatment systemic marker inflammation subject risk coronary heart disease . Methods : The current study randomize , double blind clinical trial , two treatment group . Eligible participant allocate restricted randomization use minimization method treatment group control group . The treatment group receive periodontal therapy consist instruction plaque control , supra subgingival scale root planing , oral systemic metronidazole ( 250 mg ) plus amoxicillin ( 500 mg ) tid 7 day . The control group receive plaque control instruction , supragingival scale two placebo . The study plan enroll 160 participant , 80 ech arm , 6-month period . Follow-up clinic visit schedule occur every 3 month finish treatment . Baseline follow-up clinic visit include periodontal examination , blood collection medical dental history . The following biochemical marker determine baseline 3 , 6 , 9 12 month posttherapy : total , LDL HDL lipoprotein cholesterol triglyceride , glycemia , high sensitivity C-reactive protein , fibrinogen , erythrocyte sedimentation rate white blood cell count . In diabetic patient , glycosylated hemoglobin also assess . The study conduct public health center Santiago , Chile . To eligible study , participant older 35 year fulfill medical periodontal criterion . For medical criterion participant dyslipidemia , least one follow coronary heart disease risk factor : obesity , smoking , diabetes , hypertension . The periodontal inclusion criterion : history periodontal treatment , presence least 14 natural teeth , least 4 teeth interproximal site probe depth equal high 4 mm concomitant attachment loss equal high 3 mm , > 30 % site bleed probe . The outcomes measure level serum C-reactive protein , fibrinogen , erythrosedimentation rate , white blood cell count.The outcome measure 0 , 3,6,9 , 6 month periodontal therapy .
